bug.short_desc: Desktop allows window resize in north direction

long_desc.thetext:
Peter Schneider postet the following problem on the mailing list:
I found that the current (qooxdoo 1.0.1) implementation of the desktop allows the (child-) windows to be resized (direction north) beyond the area of the desktop.
This behavior can be seen (and easily tested) in the demo browser: http://demo.qooxdoo.org/1.0.x/demobrowser/index.html#widget~Desktop.html
If you pick any of those 3 windows and resize it in the north direction beyond the pane of the tab-view. This leaves that window "un-movable" 'cause you can not access the captionbar anymore...
All other resize-directions (east, south and west) have the same behavior, but that's not so critical because you still can move, close, maximize, etc. the window. As long as you still get a grip on the captionbar.
I took a look at the 0.7.4 behavior and found that this was not possible there. (Although the complete concept was different ;) )
http://n2.nabble.com/Problem-Window-resize-North-possible-to-extend-desktop-area-td4548888.html;cid=1265875628581-216#a4548888
In my opinion, the desktop should take care of such situations and move the window on the top edge of the desktop to keep the window functional. All the other cases (not north) are not a problem because you can still use the window as it is supposed to be used.
Fixed on trunk with rev. 22568 and on branch with rev. 22569.
